books.name: The Pragmatic Programmer:  From journeyman to master
books.description:
An amazing book.  The book is organized into a series
\
            of tips that the writers stumbled upon from years of experience
\
            programming.  I spent roughly 8 months reading the book cover to 
\
            cover, as the chapters were usually so insightful, that a quick
\
            pass never did them justice.  This book changed the way I think
\
            about programming in general, and gave me cause to question 
\
            everything I do in code.  This book is probably the reason why this
\
            site uses actual integration tests for documentation, as that is
\
            one of their tips provided unter automation.
\
            The book doesn't need to be read cover to cover, as it is split up
\
            by tips.

books.name: Extreme Programming Explained
books.description:
This book is written by the most authoritative figure
\
            on XP, Kent Beck.  There is advice in here that trancends programming
\
            and at times feels like mid-eastern thought process.  Be prepared 
\
            to embrace XP with the man considered to be the founder of the
\
            movement if not one of the leading voices.

books.name: Design Patterns:  Elements of reusable Object Oriented Software
books.description:
I bought this book after reading many reviews online,
\
            and becuase it is still a highly praised book in the software world
\
            despite being first published in 1994!!  The book is organized into
\
            sections that relate to different design pattern categories, such
\
            as object creation and behavioral patterns.  Be prepared to spend a
\
            lot of time pouring over each chapter again and again until you
\
            have one of this "Aha!" moments.  Well worth the read, and definately
\
            provided an invaluable companion to me on many occasions when I
\
            was wanting to learn more about Design Patterns.
